text:
HTTP Request elements are currently tedious to create when the request contains
lots of parameters.  the use of recording controller helps but you can't always
reproduce the HTTP session. sometimes you might want to reproduce a session
based on URLs gathered in the Apache httpd access_log for example.

an improvement could be to allow URLs to be input into a request element using
cut-n-paste so that JMeter would automatically parse the URL elements. another
possibility would be to allow import of requests from a file containing a set of
URLs (one per line).
creator: aspa@kronodoc.fi

text:
Now there is an alpha access log sampler that takes Tomcat common log format, 
which should be able to use Apache's logs. This sampler was made to simulate 
production traffic. Please give it a try and see if it fits your needs. If not, 
please re-open the bug. the access log sampler can take custom parsers, if you 
happen to append additional information to your access logs.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
